overview_of_class: This course covers principles of copyright, contracts, and entertainment business practices from the perspective of the producer/artist/creator. The class reads and discusses actual cases and contract language to learn the legal structure of the entertainment industry. Discussions cover social and artistic concerns raised by legislative actions and judicial interpretations. The substantive content will survey all portions of media from print to Internet and from music to film, and videogames. Business cases are studied to actualize and relate the legal issues and opportunities to the artistic practice's financial bottom line. This class does not presume any knowledge of the legal system beyond that of the normal college student.
